business.headline: Donald Trump is a dealmaker: WEF President Børge Brende on potential US trade tariffsWorld Economic Forum President Børge Brende said while some tariffs may be introduced by the US administration, Donald Trump's ultimate goal will likely be to negotiate favourable deals.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Trump's second act: Swearing-in today, over 200 executive actions tomorrow Live UpdatesTrump oath ceremony: Donald Trump is set to be sworn in as the 47th President of the United States today. He will hit the ground running in his second term, pledging to issue "close to 100" executive orders on his first day in office on hot-button issues.

Biden's pre-emptive pardons for Dr Fauci, army general hours before Trump oathTrump, who will be inaugurated later on Monday, has previously signalled plans to target political adversaries in his second term, vowing "retribution" against those who sought to hold him accountable for the January 6 Capitol riots.

PM Modi's letter for Trump as he takes charge, S Jaishankar is messengerS Jaishankar is representing PM Modi as his special envoy at Donald Trump's inauguration in Washington. He will hand over a letter from the PM to the new US President.

Sharon Raj murder case: Who is Greeshma, youngest woman to get death penalty in Kerala?Greeshma wanted to end her relationship with Sharon as she was engaged to another man but Sharon refused, following which Greeshma conspired to kill him.

Leave us alone: Kareena Kapoor Khan reacts to reel in now-deleted angry postIn a social media post, actor Kareena Kapoor Khan requested the media to respect her family's privacy following a knife attack on Saif Ali Khan. However, she deleted the post later.

Joe Biden, wife Jill meet Donald Trump and wife Melania ahead of inaugurationDonald Trump Swearing In Ceremony Live Updates: Donald Trump will take the oath as the 47th President of the United States in an inauguration ceremony at the Capitol Rotunda in Washington DC on Monday (local time). The inauguration ceremony was shifted indoors because of the forecast of severe windchill. Ahead of the mega event, External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar reached the United States to represent India. He also held meetings with his counterparts from Australia and Japan here during which they discussed bilateral issues and those pertaining to QUAD. Follow India Today for all the latest updates of Donald Trump's swearing-in ceremony.

Atul Subhash's wife gets child's custody, Supreme Court dismisses mother's pleaThe Supreme Court has allowed Atul Subhash's wife, who was blamed by the techie in the suicide note he left behind, to have custody of their 4-year-old son.

Trump supporters get teary-eyed ahead of inauguration: 'He loves us'Excitement is palpable among the MAGA supporters as they wait for President-elect Donald Trump to take his place in the White House. Braving cold and rain, two women supporters stood endlessly in the long line for Trump's inauguration. India Today TV's Anjana Om Kashyap, who is reporting live from Washington DC, spoke to the Trump supporters and asked them what they would like to say to Trump.  "Thank you, thank you for saving us," one of them said. 

The two women got teary-eyed.

"He is for us, he loves us, he wants to save our country," one of them said. "He almost died two times."

Jab Neeraj met Himani: Olympian's uncle shares couple's love story Neeraj Chopra's uncle, Surendra Chopra, revealed details about the Olympian's destination wedding in Shimla in an interview with India Today. The Olympic medallist tied the knot with his long-time girlfriend, Himani Mor, a former tennis player.

RG Kar rape-murder convict gets life term, court says 'not rarest of rare case'The CBI court on Monday sentenced Sanjay Roy to life imprisonment till death and a fine of Rs 50,000 for the rape and murder of a trainee doctor at Kolkata's RG Kar Hospital last year.

Spiritual guru Premanand Maharaj's advice on same-sex relations goes viralA man attended the spiritual guru's satsang and revealed that while his family was pushing him to get married, he felt drawn to men. Here's what Premanand Maharaj said.

Men will be men: Trump to sign gender-identity Executive Order on Day 1One of Donald Trump's first executive orders will mandate government documents in the US to reflect biological sex instead of self-assessed gender identity, says a report. It would also end tax-funded sex change surgeries for inmates. The order will also remove biological men from women's jails, sports and locker rooms.

This even as Pakistan hailed the USD 230-million airport as a "symbol of friendship". Critics are calling it another cog in Beijing's debt-trap diplomacy.
